citations.narrative:
The facility has not vaccinated five adult dogs (Reese, Luna, Lacey, Jojo, and Cassie) for Rabies in accordance with the
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Failure to follow a written and approved schedule by the attending
veterinarian of vaccination administration for contagious and deadly diseases can result in an increased risk of disease
exposure to the dogs. Correct by ensuring that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases and sampling and
treatment of parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian is followed.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 20-June-2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has not vaccinated five adult dogs (Reese, Luna, Lacey, Jojo, and Cassie) for Rabies in accordance with the 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Failure to follow a written and approved schedule by the attending 
veterinarian of vaccination administration for contagious and deadly diseases can result in an increased risk of disease 
exposure to the dogs. Correct by ensuring that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases and sampling and 
treatment of parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian is followed. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 20-June-2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
